website_summaries.verdict: As an FDA-approved electric nasal aspirator, this device makes it simple to clean out a baby’s nose and is also convenient to clean the device.
pros: Conveniently includes 3 differently sized silicone tips
FDA approved model that has been medically tested
Easy to clean as it’s completely waterproof and doesn’t have an abundance of pieces
Small in size, which makes it easily portable
cons: Is a bit loud while in use

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have For All Moms!!
customer_reviews.text: My mom bought me this yesterday, and it arrived today! Let’s just take a moment and be in awe with Amazing for amazing shipping deals. Now, unto the aspirador. This is an amazing thing to have in your arsenal of things for baby. I don’t know how I’m just getting one with my third. I don’t know how I survived without it. Safe to say, i will always be buying one of these as gifts for any future mama friends I have because we all need to have one on hand. Picture description: My 2 mo daughter is very congested and this just sucked it right up in seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third baby and I can’t believe I’m only now finding out about this product ! I’m in love! It’s so easy and efficient I’m really grateful to have found it. My newborn was born in winter and had stuffy nose but I had the nose frida type thing that you use your own suction and sometimes it’s effective but this time it literally did nothing. So I bought this and FINALLY my sweet girl could breathe and eat and we could all sleep. I’m seriously buying this for everyone’s baby shower I go to. My baby doesn’t even hate it !
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Read this
customer_reviews.text: HELLO, I purchased this product on October 8th 2016. It's been over a year now and the product still works flawlessly. It provides enough suction to take out any mucus stuck behind throat and or lodged in tiny noses. I recently lost the last silicone tip that came in the original packaging and tried buying replacement ones on Amazon which they did not have. I emailed OCCObaby directly and I was promptly helped and sent replacement tips for free no questions asked. I fully recommend this product not only because it works great but because of its awesome customer service making this product last even longer.
customer_reviews.author: meh

customer_reviews.title: The best!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is AMAZING!! My son (4 months) would scream and carry on horribly the second you came near him with the "bulb". So desperately i started to explore my options and came across this product. I was a bit skeptical at first because i heard so many people say how electric ones don't work. After reading the reviews i decided to give it a chance and i am SO happy i did. It has worked wonders for us and my son is now calm while i am cleaning his nose!!! Couldn't have asked for anything more!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Adams

customer_reviews.title: Best booger snatcher out there
customer_reviews.text: Best nose sucker a parent could ever have for their baby! I’m still just using the smallest nipple on it for my 11 month old (mainly because I haven’t gotten around to changing it out, but it still works great on her)! When she was smaller and her nose was really stuffy, I’d first spray Little Remedies Nasal spray and then booger suck next. The one you use your own sucking works great too! I use a qtip to clean out the nipples. When she was littler she loved chewing on the necklace too. I’d highly recommend this to other parents!!!
customer_reviews.author: Maurita

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money! Great suction!
customer_reviews.text: This was a life saver during my daughters cold. She's only 7 months now.. 6 at the time and she was so congested this would suck it out really good. Make sure you're using the correct size nasal attachment bc it effects the suction. Also, it's loud and she didn't like it at first at all. We hated holding her down but this was the quickest most effective way to get her passages clean. Worth the money but be aware you might have to hold your munchkin down.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan

customer_reviews.title: Simple, effective
customer_reviews.text: Simple use. Prefer this over manual suction bulb or mouth suction units. The power button activates only while being pushed, so it is easy to quickly suction without excessively agitating our infant.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: OCCObaby has integrity and stands behind their product.
customer_reviews.text: My initial review was somewhat negative due to the fact that the machine did not have enough suction and did not work for me. Immediately Andrea from OCCObaby made contact with me to try and help fix the issue. Andrea gave me information that there could be different options on why the machine was not working well and gave me the option to repurchase it with credit. This action Andrea took is a true display of integrity by the company, OCCObaby. I will definitely retry this product!
customer_reviews.author: Reggie

customer_reviews.title: Has no suction!!!
customer_reviews.text: Coming from a pediatric nurse I was interested in getting an electric nasal suction for my son to try out being completely skeptical.. and I knew I knew better. Product is easy to clean and easy to use, however don’t waste your money!! Very low suction and wouldn’t even get the visible mucous out much less what you can’t see. Just save your money and get one that you can plug in and that has different suction settings or one that you control with your own mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn Blank

customer_reviews.title: Great boogie sucker
customer_reviews.text: Gentle, continuous suction without having to run out of breath only to have those boogies sucked right back up into those nasal cavities! Baby HATES it. I'd take away a star for that butt frankly he hates anything anywhere near his nose anyway so... it's a lot more expensive as the mom powered boogie sucker(though it came with one as a bonus so that's in the diaper bag now) but it really does do a good job so as the mom of a baby with seasonal allergies I whole heartedly approve of this product
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews, but I have to for this one because it's such a great product! I wish I bought this 3 years ago when my daughter was an infant! Granted I've only had it for a week, but my daughter is in the middle of her 5th head cold in 3 months! Her nose was getting so sore from the bulb syringe even though it worked great. But this is so much safer, faster, less gross and more effective! I do not regret getting it! I love this!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia D. Bodine

customer_reviews.title: A must have for babies and toddlers!
customer_reviews.text: This nasal aspirator is the bees knees! The suction is strong enough to get the job done but gentle enough for the baby's tiny nose. The traditional aspirators don't work well and I just couldn't stomach the one you have to suck the boogers out. This was the perfect alternative. We use it everyday on our 16 month old. She doesn't care for it but it is a necessity with her seasonal allergies. It is well worth the money. This will be my go to baby shower gift now!
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: A+ absolutely amazing product. Sucks all the boogies out quickly and easily
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. As you can see from the photos, it works! It sucks all the boogies out quickly and easily. I hated the nose Frida, this thing is so much quicker and easier. A+
customer_reviews.author: Hope Abel

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase for our child with allergies
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old has terrible allergic rhinitis. She's taking two different allergy medicines. We tried all kinds of nasal aspirators and nothing would really help drain her nasal sinuses. This was recommended to us by my sister-in-law. This is the only thing that has worked for us. My toddler finally has some relief. We use it nightly and have been using it for about a month now. So far, the battery life is good.
customer_reviews.author: Anne K.

customer_reviews.title: doesn’t suck anything out
customer_reviews.text: It didn’t work for us at all.. doesn’t suck anything out.. and it’s soooooo noisy my baby was terrified when I did go close to his face with that machine, it’s right in his face.. I ended up ordering the one which can connect to the vacuum and it works amazingly!!!
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work. Save your time and  money
customer_reviews.text: The unit didnt work. Snot got into the line of the manual aspirator and not collection cup. There is a lifetime warranty..... but it will be replaced with same crap. Customer service told me thay the electric aspirstor and manual aspirator were defective. Either im just (un)lucky or it is a poor quality product. I got same day shipping because my baby is sick and miserable..... ugh. Now to find something legit
customer_reviews.author: Kascha Brown

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Im beyond pissed off i bought this yesterday because 2 of my kids are sick & my baby has snot that is non stop. I barely used it 4 times when i went to use it again THE SUCTION ISNT WORKING. Wtf how is that even possible when its brand new. Then i went to use the manual & the f'in snot went in my mouth im so pissed off i wasted my money on this. Cant believe how many positive reviews this got maybe because they got the product for free smfh. Lets just say im getting my money back!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Faaea

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work, save your money
customer_reviews.text: This product’s suction is SO light that it is completely ineffective. Not only that, my ten month old daughter is terrified of it, always has been. The sound isn’t necessarily startling, it’s actually a fairly gentle sound, but my baby hates it. I had better luck using a two dollar nasal bulb, which she also hates, but at least it works better by comparison. The only thing good about this product is the packaging and design. Overall, it is a complete waste. I’d like to send it back for a refund, but I don’t feel right about it considering it’s been up my daughter’s nose. I do not recommend this nasal aspirator.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: As a Respiratory Therapist...
customer_reviews.text: I am Respiratory Therapist... so I am used to suctioning patients of every age with hospital grade equipment. I highly endorse this product. It is easy to use & safe for your little ones. Lots of options & the manual/oral powered aspirator is a great bonus. As a RT, I do wish it had more suction power but I also understand needing to keep it safe for the untrained public. This is a nice compromise. Only issue I have with it is the sealing O rings often fall off when removing the tips & can easily get lost. No replacement info was found in the product literature
customer_reviews.author: S. Cayko

customer_reviews.title: Better for older kids or less wiggly babies
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to use, great at snot sucking. The tip is soft and easy to remove and clean. That being said, the tip is pointed so it's not safe if using in a wiggly squirmy baby. I had to have my husband or nanny hold down my 7 mo daughter's arms and body so I wouldn't accidentally stick her in the eye. Once it was in her nostril it was fast. Just press the button and bingo! Maybe pressing the button before it goes into the nostril is faster esp if baby is wiggly like mine. The hole is small so thick snot doesn't get sucked up as easily. Otherwise great product.
customer_reviews.author: kristy

customer_reviews.title: Have a Tissue on Standby
customer_reviews.text: First runny nose as a parent was met with a wiggly crying baby who hated the nosefrida "five star" snot sucker. Well I was the sucker because it barely worked and I IMMEDIATELY got the cold my baby had. The filter on that thing had huge holes I can not figure out for the life of me how it has great ratings. Despite my baby still hating the process of having her nose sucked it has been way easier on us both to have the motorized suction. While I don't think any product could simulate the release of an actual blown nose, this comes close enough for everyone to feel/see some relief. Have a tissue nearby for those stick ones!
customer_reviews.author: Honestly_Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This thing is real garbage. What a waste of $30. I’ve been using the baby vac for 3 years now and was hoping to find a replacement that didn’t need a vacuum to be used, so you can imagine my excitement when I came across this thing! I didn’t have high hopes for it working on my 3 year old but I really thought it would be great for my 6 month old. Lol no. Couldn’t even get out a booger that I could see! I ended up just throwing this stupid thing out and grabbing the boogie bulb that you get from the hospital lol. Anyways, don’t waste your money on this thing. It really doesn’t work
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Jones

customer_reviews.title: My weird 8 month old thinks it’s funny
customer_reviews.text: I’m pretty impressed at the suction this gets. I had another one that was a different brand, but it broke. It was good too, but the suction wasn’t as powerful as this one. Also my kid HATED when I used the old one. For whatever reason with this new one, he thinks it’s funny when I’m trying to suction his nose. 😂 What a weirdo. I will say it makes life SO much easier using electronic ones than trying to pin them down, hold the thing in their nose, and manually suck with your mouth. Now having used 2 different brands of electric suckers, this is definitely the superior product!
customer_reviews.author: Becca

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It already stopped working. We’ve only had it for 5 months. We take great care of it. My daughter is now sick and we don’t have a functioning occo. Beware!!! Product is great when working but has very short life span!!!
customer_reviews.author: Reed

customer_reviews.title: No SUCTION
customer_reviews.text: We tried using the suction everyday hoping to see that it will work since it was so much easier to use than the Nose Frida. BUT it doesn't have enough power to suction out anything. My child has allergies and a very runny nose, so there is much that's needed to be suctioned out. However, the aspiratored failed to get anything out, so we had to go back to using Nose Frida. I do not reccomend this product. I am in the process of returning.
customer_reviews.author: Taresa Lee

customer_reviews.title: Works great - but doesn't last very long compared to other brands
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product in November 2017 (approximately 2 years ago) and while it was working, it was great. Easy to clean and suction power was sufficient enough to do what needs to be done. The low rating here is for the durability issue where it's only been 2 years with light use and it just stopped working for no reason. I initially thought it was because of the battery, but after changing the batteries multiple times, I still can't get it to work. This is very unfortunate because I actually purchased similar electric nasal aspirator from another vendor (Little Martins Drawer Baby Electric Nasal Aspirator) for my son in 2015, and that one is still working.
customer_reviews.author: Devi

customer_reviews.title: Not enough suction
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if it’s just my Device, but this does not do anything for my babies boogies. I can see the boogie and wiggle it around and it still will not suck out the boogies. I’ve read so many reviews and mine does not do this whatsoever. Is there something I’m missing as far as it being sealed properly? I’ve changed out the batteries to see if it was just low power. I even tried this on myself when I had a stuffy nose and literally nothing comes out.
customer_reviews.author: mandilicious

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: ***UPDATE*** Seller emailed me quickly after I posted review. Sending another one. I will update review after receiving new one. I hope it works. Doesn’t work. Doesn’t suck ANYTHING. The Frieda baby sucker sucks every particle of snot out. Very disappointed in this product. Do not buy. Go buy a manual noseucker (not a bulb Bc they don’t work either).
customer_reviews.author: Olivesparents

customer_reviews.title: Just doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work. I was sick of sucking up into my lungs my baby’s sickness/infection/whathaveyou. Bought this and one that attaches to a vacuum (from amazon). Vacuum one was awesome. But inconvenient bc...uh...the vacuum requirement. This doesn’t even feel suction on your hand it just doesn’t work. Ended up using the free nosefrida knock off that came with this. Super frustrating and a waste of money. Ugh
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Harper

customer_reviews.title: My baby loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My baby pretty much had a runny nose the entire winter, she hated any suckers I got. I decided to get this item in hopes that it can work better, funny enough, my baby actually loves the vibration.... and let’s me get into her nose with no resistance! The suction is not super strong, but strong enough to get all her boogies out, we use it with a saline spray (spray first, then suction). I don’t think I’d want the suction to be any stronger as I’d feel like it’s dangerous. All around, an amazing investment! Wish I got it as soon as she was born!
customer_reviews.author: ChrisPrime

customer_reviews.title: Very effective
customer_reviews.text: It’s so heartbreaking when your little one is congested and can’t breath through their nose. This product is amazing for getting on the snot out. This thing works so incredibly well. I have used the bulb syringe with very little luck. I was recommended the nose Frieda by my child’s pediatrician which worked fairly well but I got deathly sick after using it. My little one doesn’t like this, understandly, but is works super well and it’s quick so I’m done within a few seconds. Before using it she was fussy and couldn’t suck her pacifier because she was so congeated. After using this she took her pacifier and went to sleep being able to breath through her nose.
customer_reviews.author: J&A Feight

customer_reviews.title: Does it job well!
customer_reviews.text: Baby girl had the flu and her poor nose was so red. I couldn't imagine what it would look like after a week of this. I ordered this Nasal Aspirator and had it sent out immediately. My kid is three So I just bribed her with a few goodies and she was using this on her own in no time. My kid loves her nose sucker. Im happy with it. Simple, was to use and does it job.
customer_reviews.author: Mom R

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money folks.
customer_reviews.text: It's always tough when your little one is sick, everyone suffers. This product isn't going to help anyone. Neither of the three tips reach deep enough into the sinuses to effectively remove snot and the suction is insufficient. Sure, the product is simple, you press a button and it begins sucking. Sure, it's easy to disassemble for cleaning purposes BUT you'll NEVER have to clean it because IT DOESN'T WORK. Forget about the battery powered nasal aspirator, what a complete waste. The only good thing about this purchase was that it came with the oral snot sucker, THAT works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Breanna S.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to try this because my baby has been congested and I think I got sick from using the nose Frida. However, I haven’t been able to get even a single booger out of her nose despite trying over and over again with this. Honestly, the bulb sucker is more effective than this, which says a lot. Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Stop searching! This is the nasal aspirator you need!
customer_reviews.text: I have used several types of nasal aspirators - the bulb, the manual suction (nose Frida), and a few different battery-operated ones. I've never been satisfied with the various types - until now. This is the perfect nasal aspirator. It is easy to clean, easy to operate (which isn't an easy feat, considering you're often using this on a squirmy baby). The suction is the perfect balance - it actually removes mucous without hurting baby. My little girl is calm while I'm using this, even though she wasn't so calm with other brands. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amy M Xu

customer_reviews.title: Better than the hospital bulb
customer_reviews.text: Overall I prefer this much more than the bulb the send you home from the hospital with. It comes with several tips and another piece that you can use with just your mouth. The only downside to this is it does take some time to get use to be able to get everything out of your LO nose and it seems like the tip is a little big. It may be that it needs to be that wide to get everything out, but I feel like it is still too large in our LO nose. I wish there was a tip that was a little smaller, but overall it does the job once you get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Kstone34

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! My baby doesn't care about the noise, he's just not a fan of ANYTHING near his nose. Which is why I prefer this over the Frida. With the Frida I need my husband to help because the baby thrashes his head back and forth, so someone has to hold his head steady, then I need a hand to hold the end in the baby's nose and another hand to hold the end in my mouth. But the occobaby is so fast and easy!
customer_reviews.author: Shelli Stargell

customer_reviews.title: Finally an aspirator that works for babies
customer_reviews.text: We purchased 4 other aspirators for our 12 week old daughter and had no luck getting out any significant boogies. After 1 use with this aspirator our daughter was actually smiling as the cup was filling with all that was clogging up her little nose. We definitely recommend using saline before and during as it helps loosen everything up and causes the them to not fear it so much. This device is quiet compared to other units and so we don’t scare her we suction her cheeks and forehead before we put it in her nose and we’ve have 100% success. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Krista Z

customer_reviews.title: Better than anything out there!!! Definite Buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this nasal aspirator. We ordered a Graco aspirator thinking "bigger name, better product" ...bad idea. The aspirator stopped working within a day. Occobaby on the other hand is gentle and does a great job of getting those boogers out. It has worked like a charm since day one. The gentle silicone tip is not harsh on the baby and the motor is strong enough that it gets most of the gunk out(we don't want it too strong). I don't think I will need another aspirator but if I need it or gift someone an aspirator, it would be this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Babies think it's funny
customer_reviews.text: Our 6moold twins find this a funny little device, and giggle when it is used. I take that to mean it doesn't hurt. I like that it is easy to clean, but the suction could be better. I find myself using this first to get mucus close to the outside and then one of the classic bulbs to get it fully out. I've used it on myself just to test it out, and it did work to help clear me out! I prefer to use it after I use a saline spray on the babies, seems to work best this way.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Brown

customer_reviews.title: It actually works!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this one evening when my 2 month old was extra snotty...we have the Nose Frida but I cannot stomach that thing and my husband has to do it for me!! I had low expectations on this just because -- but this thing actually works! The first time I used it I just held it in his nose and it didn't pull anything out, but the next time I tried it, I moved it around in circles and it pulled a lot of snot out!! My baby hated it -- but he hates the nose frida too! If you're thinking about getting this -- just do it. Save your stomach from using the Nose Frida!!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen B.

customer_reviews.title: Very Gentle
customer_reviews.text: Why didn’t I have this sooner!! My baby gets little boogies daily! The bulb syringe was way too bothersome for him so I got this and used it for the first time today after nearly 8 weeks and my baby didn’t even cry! It’s super gentle with good suction, & easy to clean. My only critique is there’s no storage included. I don’t like keeping cardboard around my home for sanitary reasons so keeping the box isn’t an option, I’d recommend purchasing a pencil pouch to keep this and the parts in!
customer_reviews.author: Keshia_518

customer_reviews.title: Of course your face would not have to turn blue to suck but, this Aspirator sure does not have that ...
customer_reviews.text: it is not greatly sucking boogers. i was using nose frida for 2 years and this is the new thing i am trying. Of course your face would not have to turn blue to suck but, this Aspirator sure does not have that kind of power of suction. if it is one of those wooey gooey thick booger, you might have to try harder and use more time to suck them out .
customer_reviews.author: Robert McGonigal

customer_reviews.title: So far so good - baby laughing at it!
customer_reviews.text: I was diehard Nose Frida user with my first. I ordered this to try out with #2 getting a cold and a runny nose... I'm a convert to the ways of the electric aspirator! The baby didn't mind this much at all, she actually was laughing while I was doing it! My toddler was leery but then he was never a fan of the nose frida either, or any aspirator. But this does the job very quickly as long as you get it pointed in correctly, so that's a lot better than a manual suction!
customer_reviews.author: Sam C.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only used the OCCObaby Nasal Aspirator a few times now, but it is a world of difference between the other types we’ve tried. We have three different types of bulbs, the brand that you manual suck the snot out and now the OCCObaby. The OCCObaby is by far the most effective. Also, as most babies do, my 5 month old son HATES the nasal aspirators. With this one, he fusses right at first, but then settles down and let’s me use it without having to fight him on it. I’m not kidding, the amount of stuff it pulled out of his nose makes me believe it completely cleared his nose, sinuses and throat. Five stars from me!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Not the Best
customer_reviews.text: It's a good product to have. It's well made. Nice design and holds in hand pretty well. The suction power is ok. I put brand new batteries in and its works ok. I expected it to be a bit more powerful than it is. The good thing is that the it is gentle and soft on your baby's nostrils. Cleans up good too. I personally prefer FRIDA aspirator cause even its manual but it definitely sucks out lots more and takes very little to maintain.
customer_reviews.author: Lena

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't do anything...
customer_reviews.text: I've tried it multiple times on my little one, I've used saline drops as well, the suction isn't even powerful enough to suck out the saline. I don't know what these folks who gave this an awesome rating were smoking, but they got me to waste my money on it..... Thanks :/
customer_reviews.author: JennyBloom

customer_reviews.title: This really works. A++++++
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews, but really wanted to express my thanks to OCCObaby. I tried many other products for my 9th old, but this is the only one that really worked. I tried the aspirator bulbs, and the manual tube kind..but was disappointed. This one costs more money..but is really worth it...especially for infants. Also, I like the fact that the tips can be easily removed to clean them.
customer_reviews.author: Savvy shopper

customer_reviews.title: ... was excited to get this because it had a great review but I received my package and it was ...
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this because it had a great review but I received my package and it was missing a tip and a manual snot sucker. I was pretty upset. I wanted to try it too to even see if it works but the tip I needed for my newborn was the tip that was missing! 😬 Update: Great customer service...Andrea helped me out, she investigated what went wrong and she offered me a new aspirator. Used it and it worked great took snot out easy! Easy to use and good suction power.
customer_reviews.author: Althea

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love how effective this works! Saline drops helped in addition to an air humidifier and steam showers but this by itself is just such an amazing product! My baby was having trouble with her mucus witch was effecting her suckling pressure so I bought it eimedetly and it worked wonderfully! She was so relieved as well.... This product worked so good infact I bought one for my niece who is sick as well!
customer_reviews.author: Kali

customer_reviews.title: SO GENTLE!
customer_reviews.text: Both of my little ones have lots of mucus and we have tried so many solutions. We were using the nose frieda most often, but they would just scream evertime we did it. A Dr. in Children's Hospital suggested a battery powered suction. The first time I tried it I thought for sure it wasn't working, because my 4 month old didn't even make a peep. Then I did it on my 1.5 year old and he didn't cry either... When I emptied the compartment and saw mucus I was very surprised! Now I love it and I used it all the time!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie Kreft

customer_reviews.title: Nicely designed product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a replacement that my Dr wanted me to get. He wanted me to get suction tips but I do not have a suction machine. As I investigated this product I thought I could use it for suctioning out my salivary ducts. It works. It’s a challenge finding the ducts but once found I place the tip and suction to try and get thick mucus out. It works. I have Sjorgrems Syndrome. No saliva
customer_reviews.author: cookie

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I use to use the nosefrida that you suck and I'll tell you never again! This thing is awesome! It's kind of loud and a pain to clean because you have to do it everything time and then has to dry out but still easy to clean for what it is. If the water doesnt dry out before using it is pushed out and sprays, likely in your face. Suction is good. I tend to use one head piece - the one that is the skinniest because when I'm using it my child is sick and usually stuffed up there, not so much at the opening of the nose (I just wipe that away)
customer_reviews.author: LDay

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I remember seeing an ad for this and thinking it’s no way this thing works. But was I wrong! My baby girl has a small nose and using the sucker that they give you at the hospital or when you get the grooming kit for the babies wouldn’t fit in her nose and it was always a fight to use it on her. But with this? Oh a life saver! The suction is perfect, easy to use, and my newborn doesn’t mind me using it on her! Wins all around! Definitely a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: It mostly works for wet boogers not dry which is what I really needed it for. The tips are good sizes for my babys nose but this was a struggle to use to get anything out really, even when I was using it for wet boogers. It would kinda help bring them to the surface but it never really suctioned them properly into the chamber for boogers. I would still have to use a tissue to grab the boogers out. It's definitely overpriced for the little suction that it does give. It works sometimes but not consistent enough to really be worth it. I ended up buying baby nose tweezers which works better for dry and wet boogers.
customer_reviews.author: C. Yang

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: We have had no luck with this product. We use the nose frida and get great results and I was just hoping this would be a little quicker. We get noting out at all when using this and my son has visible snot coming from his nose so something should be collecting. We have tried all the tips and still get nothing. Wishing we hadn’t wasted the money and just stuck with the manual one.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Not fur us
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to give a rating for this product. Because it didn't do what we wanted...doesn't mean that the product is bad. It has some good suction but...but I think for our LO we need more suction. I had to return it and buy one that has more umph to it. Our LO is 3 months old and has a lot of congestion. We were able to get more out with the Nose Frida. Maybe when our LO is older and the snot is not as thick and way up in there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t suck mucus at all, the product over all does suck tho. Because it’s a waste.
customer_reviews.text: This product is absolute garbage. I have a hard time using the manual asperstors because my lung capacity isn’t great and I run out of breath and it’s just hard so we thought we would try this asperator and it got nothing out. Went back to using my trusty old manual asperator and it got a lot of mucus out. Good idea but Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Brown

customer_reviews.title: Newborn Certified!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our first baby 18 months ago...it's super easy to use and even easier to clean (which is why we highly recommend it). Fast forward to new baby that we just brought home and we purchased another one...which is why it only gets 4 stars. Our first set needed the newborn piece which tore from washing and OCCObaby doesn't sell replacement parts! Other than that, well worth the $40 purchase to ensure mold isn't growing in the hidden hospital nose sucker!
customer_reviews.author: Pj & Becky

customer_reviews.title: This is the best thing ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say it enough this nasal aspirator is a great product I wish I had found out about it sooner. I used to have the Nose Frida and the baby hated it but this is definitely an upgrade since you can clear the congestion faster. When you have a sick baby the only thing you want is to help them in any way you can, this product clears congestion 100% and it is very clean and effective. Also they have superb customer service, my product had a bit of an issue with suction and they fixed it right away. I have already recommended it to all my friends and family with babies and kids. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work. No suction.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work. It hardly has any suction. I tried swirling and scooping it around in baby’s nose and it didn’t do a thing. I even tried it with my daughter who is a little bit older than him and she said she didn’t feel any suction. Disappointed, especially when I needed it the most for my sick baby. Luckily I was able to return it to amazon when I told them I tried using it and it didn’t do its job.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase ...life saver
customer_reviews.text: This product was a life saver my preemie baby had GERD and he spots up Everytime he eats sometime the spit up would come threw his nose . Having this product ensured that I can suction my baby with ease I would recommend this product to any mother it's great . The container that hold the secretions is a bit small and sometimes the secretions can sleep into the handle part of the suction which makes cleaning a little difficult. Overall this product is worth the money 👌
customer_reviews.author: Nova

customer_reviews.title: NECESSARY product
customer_reviews.text: Unlike the nose Frieda #1 keeps the virus/bacteria from getting airborne and. suctioned RIGHT into your lungs ( even if you are already exposed you do not want the virus/bacteria traveling right into your lungs!) #2requires no lung power to work #3SO easy!! make sure to register RIGHT away for the warranty. I did not open mindI did not open mine for a long time for a long time... so unfortunately I missed the window.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Fomitcheva

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: I REALLY wanted to love this product and am so disappointed. The pieces are WAY to big for my daughters nose, she screams when I try to use it. This has the potential to be great it just needs smaller pieces for babies with tiny nose holes.
customer_reviews.author: Calin Tackett

customer_reviews.title: Amazing customer service
customer_reviews.text: This product is great! I love that it comes with the battery powered aspirator along with the manual one, so you always have one to use while the other is getting washed. Both work great! The company is fantastic too. I lost a piece on the manual aspirator, and instead of just sending me the replacement piece (or charging me for it!), they sent me an entire new set! Amazing customer service. Thank you OCCObaby!
customer_reviews.author: Lin

customer_reviews.title: Good if you cannot get Frida to work
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have all kinds of trouble getting the nose Frida to do much of anything (yeah, probably user error), and we were getting tired of the manual bulbs. We wanted to try a battery-operated nose suction device and gave this a shot. This one cleans out our son's nose fairly well. It'll get surfacey-boogers reliably and quickly, while our son screams as if he's being tortured (he's like that with anything we use, like most babies are as I've heard). However, after using this, we use the manual bulb syringe and we're still picking up a bit of junk in there, perhaps deeper inside. Overall, it saves us a bit of time.
customer_reviews.author: AnthonyC

customer_reviews.title: I did want to return it BUT...
customer_reviews.text: For the first time using, I wanted to return it right away cause it did not work at all. Now it is an amazing product when I know how to use it like an expert. Make sure you using Saline drops around 30 seconds before suctioning. My 2 babies love it, it makes them feel comfortable. I don’t use NoseFrida anymore, this one is very easy to clean and stored. I don’t usually write reviews but I wanted to share this one with other mothers.
customer_reviews.author: NT

customer_reviews.title: The unit itself sucks. Add on is great.
customer_reviews.text: Does really suck up many boogers! My baby had the flu and his mucus was constant! We bought this as an emergency and the only thing great about it was it’s manual sucking add on that comes with it. It works a little better than the nose frida because the tip is smaller for his little nostril and it’s silicon. It’s also easy to clean cause the pieces detach. Other than that the actually unit sucks. I will say it is less harsh going into their nose because of the silicone tips but didn’t help with the deep mucus.
customer_reviews.author: ivania

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I got this product because I am not able to use nose frida. I get very discussed 🥴. So I needed something that will help my kids. I saw the Greco product and got one for my niece but I does not have a good suction so I got this one to try since the reviews are better. First product I got was defective and mucus was splashing but I contacted customer service and in no time they sent another one out. It works great. I am very happy with product and customer service.
customer_reviews.author: mgome0

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well
customer_reviews.text: My preemie has congestion due to acid reflux and I needed something that would work fast, be comfortable and not be awful like the traditional bulb. I want to love this but my only issues are I wish it came with a cover so to protect the Tip when it’s not in use. It’s bulky and A little difficult to hold while holding baby comfortably. Otherwise it works pretty great. I’m ordering a second one to keep at home an done in the diaper bag. You also want to definitely use saline drops with this for better results.
customer_reviews.author: Bronx Native

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but now powerful enough
customer_reviews.text: Great quality but I did not like how the suction worked. My baby fight with me every time I touch her nose and I kinda expected this to do the job like the nose Frisch with having a powerful but gentle suction. The machine is well made, steardy, with 3 nasal tips in total. It’s also kinda loud but my baby loved it bc it was surprising to her. It also let me suction her nose while she listened to it but as I said the suction was not woerfull enough and I had to finish with my frida.
customer_reviews.author: Galina makaranka

customer_reviews.title: This is AMAZING. It actually works
customer_reviews.text: This is AMAZING. It actually works. I've tried the Nose Frida, the squeezy bulb thingy, and another battery-operated aspirator that sucked. Well, actually that other one did not suck... not one damn bit of snot. This OccoBaby one is a lifesaver. When my little one has a cold, I use it on her before bed. It clears her out so she can sleep well and wake up less frequently. I'm totally buying these as baby shower gifts!
customer_reviews.author: MLeighs

customer_reviews.title: Suction sucks!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this under the illusion that it was great for newborns/preemies... Lies!! First of all, the 3 interchangeable pieces are way to big for my newborn, she's on the smaller side and her nostrils are small and the nose adapters are too big. Second, the suction sucks! I alway end up using a hand suction bulb because this aspirator NEVER suctions out her boogies. I honestly wouldn't recommend this particular aspirator.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Great for loose boogers
customer_reviews.text: Okay I got to say at first I didn’t really like this because my baby has only had dry boogers. I used saline but it was still like”is it doing anything” but just recently my 8month old hot wet boogers and man it sucks it right out. The only thing is she hates it going up her nose so it’s a bit hard to do it at times but I thinks that’s more the baby than the product lol
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: This product sucks but in a great way!
customer_reviews.text: Every new parent needs THIS. Since we constantly have a daycare snotty nose, this has been a life saver. I honestly don’t even understand what the rubber suction cup ball thing does. This product though is next level. Powerful suction which gets a dramatic amount of snot out (how can such a little human produce so much mucus?!). Fortunately this is also very easy to clean as long as you do it regularly- we do it after each use to ensure nothing weird happens. The only downside in my mind is that it take batteries but fortunately the batteries last awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Price

customer_reviews.title: Must have if you have a baby.
customer_reviews.text: Important to have especially with infants. Who knew it was hard to clean a baby’s nose, until this. This machine makes it a breeze. Highly recommend a saline nose spray to make it easy to remove dried up mucus. My son suffered of allergies at a very young age and this was a life saver. Beats sucking on boogers with your mouth like other contraptions on the market.
customer_reviews.author: SHoe OBSessed

customer_reviews.title: We were using a Nose Frida with pretty good success but after going to the doc and ...
customer_reviews.text: This was just OK for us. Our baby had a cold and was very snotty. We were using a Nose Frida with pretty good success but after going to the doc and having them use their machine to suck baby's snot out, I thought we could get something a little easier to use/more effective. So we bought this. It is very easy to use and has multiple tips to fit your needs. It just didn't have as much suction as we were able to produce with the Nose Frida.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Our 6 month old had her first cold. The normal “snot sucker” didn’t work and the nose Frieda concept wasn’t up our alley. The Occo is amazing! Gets the job done (love being able to see that it was productive!) easy to clean, and our baby tolerates it well when we turn it into a game!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Suction power isn’t the best
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this as an alternative to the Frida Baby Nose Frida. The suction isn’t always the best, sometimes snot will stick to the suction or start dripping from his nose. I like that I can suction my son faster with this than I can with the Frida and there isn’t a tube for him to grab. It’s easy to clean. Sometimes the snot will leak into another area if you have a decent amount in there and it falls over for a while.
customer_reviews.author: SEB86

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this, I was not too sure i was going to like it. I didn't feel like it was getting much snot out. When I opened it up to clean it out i was seriously surprised at how much snot it had gotten out! My baby still screams and acts like you are trying to kill her, however, my toddler thinks its cool and asks me to suck his snot with it, which he wouldnt let you come near him with a nose frida (which i love as well). I am very pleased with this product, and will be adding it to baby shower gift baskets!
customer_reviews.author: Makenzie Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work, save your money
customer_reviews.text: It has zero suction, and I mean zero. It wouldn't even suction up the very visible mucus at the front, so it absolutely wasn't pulling anything from within. Also after contacted customer service, they're rude and helpless. All they asked is to send them the proof. I mean WTF how can people show you such thing for this specific bad product. DO NOT BUY WILL JUST WASTE YOUR MONEY AND TIME!
customer_reviews.author: Yuki J

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I still am a fan of nasal Frieda but this has been more tolerable to my second child. She stays rarely calm when I run the nasal aspirator. The only thing I would say is for a newborn the nasal suction parts are a little wide for her nostrils but that could be different for each baby’s anatomy too. Otherwise I have enjoyed this product for ease of use, portability and effectiveness.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my toddler and newborn!
customer_reviews.text: This is WAY better than any bulb sucker. With a bulb sucker both of my kiddos scream bloody murder as if someone is trying to kill them. With this nasal aspirator however, my newborn calmly lays there as we suck out his boogies and my 3 year old actually asks us to use it to clear out his nose! Not only do my children like this aspirator WAY better than a bulb sucker, it works much better as well! The suction is strong but not so strong that it'll cause discomfort - even to a newborn. It's easy to use and easy to clean! Definitely 100% recommend. Wish we had this earlier!
customer_reviews.author: Banda Inku

customer_reviews.title: saline drops help the suction.
customer_reviews.text: This works way better than the nose frida. It has medium suction I wish I had a bit more power. It did come with different size tips. If you purchase this product I do recommend you buy saline drops to help your baby get the boogies out. Its very easy to clean. The small manual suction one is useless I feel like it doesn't get anything out.
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: Great Choice
customer_reviews.text: Suction is slightly weaker than I would imagine however 1- I have nothing to compare it to and 2- not sure how much suction a newborn can really take. I would love to see an oral suction option in the future. That would be great to help with some of the excessive oral secretions. But I love this one so much more than anything else I’ve previously tried. Very gentle on my son’s noses but still able to suction stuff out. Frequent suctioning is required for younger babies.
customer_reviews.author: Johansson

customer_reviews.title: Honest review
customer_reviews.text: I bought this nasal aspirator because I believed the reviews i read. The big negative point is the power of suction, this terrible. And i’ve tried the 3 différents Fitting accessories. I ended up only using the manual one that come with as additional, which means yourself have to do the suction and this one works great. I
customer_reviews.author: Julien maillet

customer_reviews.title: Helps my son sleep
customer_reviews.text: This nasal aspirator works really good, my son was having trouble sleeping through the night, due to a stuffy/ runny nose. He was waking up crying and snifflingevery 2-3 hours. He hasn't quit figured out how to blow his nose yet so this is the perfect tool to help. Since using this nasal aspirator, along with a saline mist, he had slept through the night every night since.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Not enough suction
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great design, but the suction isn’t strong enough to pull the booger’s out from my 8 week olds nose. Our pediatrician recommended that we get an electric nose aspirator since our boy is congested and only wish this one had a powerful suction to help his nose. The nose attachments are silicone and flexible which make it great for their noses. The manual one that comes with it is great and better than the nose frida.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: clean nose 👃
customer_reviews.text: wish I started it when he was a newborn. He is so afraid of the sound but it works i use it everytime after a bath as the warm 💧 bath water lose the buggies up... its not a 5 start because I was under the impression it had a a light and music turns out it was another one I was looking at.. i think those would help with the noise as it does scare them.
customer_reviews.author: Grecia Pineda

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 5.5 week old baby, his nasal congestion is pretty bad. The first time we used the device he cried for about 3 seconds and realized it helped him breath better and now gives absolutely no fuss about using it. I wish it was slightly stronger but it does what it's meant to do. We only have to use it 1-3 times a day - when we wake up, after a bath and sometimes a little before bed. I'd recommend the product to other parents. If I go to a baby shower I feel I'd purchase this for the parents to be. A complete life saver I just found it by chance!
customer_reviews.author: Jenna S

customer_reviews.title: Less traumatic to the baby
customer_reviews.text: I am a grandmother with a 7 month old grandson. He had his first cold recently and I used the manual bulb to clear his nose. It did not work. I ordered 2 of the aspirators. One for my daughter and one for me. It was quick and easy to use. Easy to clean as well!! Thank for reaching out with some suctioning tips. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: linda johnson

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this. Get a nose frida. The suction is terrible. Yes I changed batteries. Multiple times. Yes I move it around in her nose. Yes I use saline. It is still worthless. It’s easy to use if it worked. Somewhat easy to clean. I got this a few months ago and have tried multiple ways multiple times. I think the suction is even worse now.
customer_reviews.author: C.S

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second baby! She was born here in the dreaded cold and flu season and she has been so snotty since she was born. The regular bulb suction just wasn’t cutting it so I bought this in a desperate attempt to get her some relief! It has worked wonders and I absolutely love the manual suction that comes with it. We have a nose freida but I think this does so much better! This would make a great gift
customer_reviews.author: Kendra

customer_reviews.title: Mom must have
customer_reviews.text: This product has been amazing. I used the Nose Frida with her since she was a newborn and she HATED it. But it had to be done. I finally decided to try a different product and I’m so glad because this turned out to be amazing. She doesn’t scream, squirm, or fight me when we clean her nose. I don’t know if it’s the gentler suction, the sound, or just magic but she let’s me take all the time I need to get those darn boogies out. I just put a drop or 2 of saline in her nose then use this doodad to get the mucus out. And boy does it get it out. So. Gross. But so satisfying.
customer_reviews.author: Adriana

customer_reviews.title: Safe, Hygienic, and Quick Battery Operated Nose Cleaner for your Baby
customer_reviews.text: If you’re a parent like me and worried about your baby’s nose cleansing, then you must buy Quick Battery Operated Nose Cleaner. After having this amazing product at my home, I confidently and calmly able to clean my toddler’s nose without being cried him. This Safe, Hygienic, and Quick Battery Operated Nose Cleaner give instant relief to my baby whenever I try to remove bundles of wasteful, messy tissues, and moldy hospital nose bulbs. This product works amazingly for us and we’re really very happy to have it in my home.
customer_reviews.author: LaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLaLa

customer_reviews.title: Suction is weak - Nose Frida is way better
customer_reviews.text: We have two infants and we've always used Nose Frida. However, the babies keep getting us sick so we thought we'd try an aspirator. The suction is awful on this - we keep trying but the little cup is always empty. But the Nose Frida is pulling all kinds of junk out of their noses. A family member gave us a Graco and it works much better so we're returning this one.
customer_reviews.author: Hazel Detweiler

customer_reviews.title: Easy, quiet, quick!
customer_reviews.text: This product is excellent! The Nose Frida was ok and it worked when baby was tiny. But now he’s older and more active. This product is awesome because it’s quick and quiet and does the job very well. Definitely use the saline solution with it. I’ll typically put in the saline solution and then change his diaper and by that time, he’s ready to be snot-sucked. I’ve actually recommended this product to all my friends with kids. Because when you’re a mom and find something that works, you don’t keep it a secret!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Fashionista

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in May 2019 for my twin grandbabies . My son recently thanked me again for getting this one. He said hands down great product. You see, he had another brand and was unhappy with it and it broke easy. Which is why I researched and bought them this one. Since he had twins, my concern was of the quality and effectiveness. My son gave me his approval after several months of use. Item is intact and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Low Suction and Stopped Working
customer_reviews.text: The first 2-3 tries it seemed to work. You had to use saline to loosen the boogers since the suction wasn't the greatest. However, our son liked it and laughed when we used it on him. Then it slowly started giving out. It wouldn't power on unless you messed with the batteries or changed them. We went through 2 sets before it finally refused to power on at all. Ended up throwing it away. Waste
customer_reviews.author: KelleyFC

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: tried it last night with the baby. Works great! sucks out the snot. The bulb type aspirator is not strong/fast enough, and the mouth type gets us sick. This thing sucks out all the boogers. Baby hates it but she feels better later. They also have various tips depending on the nostril
customer_reviews.author: rayzredge

product_meta.title: OCCObaby Baby Nasal Aspirator - Safe Hygienic and Quick Battery Operated Nose Cleaner with 3 Sizes of Nose Tips Includes Bonus Manual Snot Sucker for Newborns and Toddlers (Limited Edition)
feature_bullets: Three sizes of silicone tips - the perfect suction for every size stuffy nose, no filters needed - all you need to get those boogers out with no additional spending.
Professional medical-grade quality - Safe for newborns and toddlers while still powerful enough to suck all the mucus, boogers and snot out immediately. BPA and Latex free.
Waterproof and easy to clean - Simply open the mucus collection cup and rinse with hot soapy water. You’ll never worry again about exposing your baby to bacteria or mol
100% money-back guarantee - Backed by the manufacturer's warranty.
Rest assured that you are buying the #1 most convenient and easy to operate electric nasal aspirator for your child.
